author: Ryan Daws
description:
Software developers worldwide are using AI assistants to boost their coding productivity, but security hasn’t kept pace with adoption. AI-generated code frequently contains vulnerabilities: insecure defaults, missing input validation, hardcoded secrets, weak cryptography, and deprecated dependencies. These flaws slip into production unnoticed. The tech industry has needed a unified, open approach to secure AI-assisted coding. […]

The post Cisco tackles AI coding security with open-source framework appeared first on Developer Tech News.
title: Cisco tackles AI coding security with open-source framework
